alert.note: Alert for Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Yuma County through 830 PM MDT... At 800 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles northeast of Cope, or 18 miles south of Yuma, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of Yuma County, including the following locations... Heartstrong, Abarr and Vernon. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 243 and 248. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
